meanings.definition: The way in which something, such as a system or organization, is arranged or organized.
meanings.sent1: The setups of the desks in the classroom were changed for group work.
meanings.sent2: The setups of the chairs at the event made it easy for everyone to see the speaker.
meanings.sent3: The setups for the party were so confusing that guests kept getting lost.
meanings.sent4: The setups of the chess pieces on the board determined the strategy of the game.
meanings.sent5: The setups of the traffic lights helped regulate the flow of cars smoothly.

meanings.definition: A situation in which someone is tricked or cheated.
meanings.sent1: She found herself in a setups where she was promised a prize but received nothing.
meanings.sent2: The setups in the movie plot caught the audience by surprise.
meanings.sent3: The setups in the magic show left the audience wondering how it was done.
meanings.sent4: The setups in the scam were so elaborate that many fell for it.
meanings.sent5: The setups in the prank were so clever that even the victim had to laugh.

meanings.definition: The process of preparing equipment or software for use.
meanings.sent1: The setups of the computers in the lab were completed before the class started.
meanings.sent2: The setups of the new software took longer than expected due to technical issues.
meanings.sent3: The setups of the stage equipment were done quickly by the experienced crew.
meanings.sent4: The setups of the sound system were crucial for the success of the concert.
meanings.sent5: The setups of the camping gear were done efficiently to save time during the trip.
